title: Product Owner
description:
Product Owner - Fleet Management Solutions - Frankfurt - €60-65k - Hybrid (2 days WFH)




Fantastic opportunity to manage a brand new Fleet Management application. This position will require you to communicate with potential clients, learning what they would value from a Fleet Management Solution, and advising whether this would be possible from a technical perspective.




In this B2B role, you will be working in a start-up environment, and must be able to manage adapt to all challenges that will come your way, helping grow the Fleet Management Solution from the ground up.




You will be responsible for:

 * Driving the fleet management solution - working with stakeholders such as potential clients, software engineering teams, and senior management.
 * Researching commercial automotive trends
 * Collecting and analysing customer feedback and reporting this back to the relevant teams



For this role, you will need:

 * Over 5 years experience in the Automotive industry
 * Experience with Fleet Management Solutions
 * Excellent communication skills (English) as you will be dealing with clients directly
 * The ability flourish in a start-up environment
 * Good technical knowledge




Benefits:

 * €60-65k base salary
 * 1 month bonus
 * Relocation package (If needed)
 * Flexible working




This role can't offer work visa's, and must be onsite in Frankfurt 3 days per week. If this role is of interest, please click apply

title: Product Owner
description:
Role Overview:




A leading renewable energy company is seeking a Program Manager for Security & Resilience to ensure the scalability, availability, and security of its digital products across cloud and IoT platforms. This role involves working cross-functionally to enhance security, business continuity, and resilience for advanced smart energy systems and infrastructure. This is an exciting opportunity for a seasoned program manager to drive impactful solutions in a rapidly evolving sector.




Key Responsibilities:




 * Lead programs to secure and optimize IoT-enabled energy systems, integrating renewable energy solutions, smart meters, and energy management technologies.
 * Ensure the reliability and security of cloud-based platforms connecting smart devices, maintaining performance in a scaling infrastructure.
 * Develop and implement robust business continuity and resilience practices for renewable energy ecosystems, heating solutions, and EV charging technologies.
 * Collaborate with technical teams to address vulnerabilities, improve system availability, and integrate advanced energy management solutions.
 * Coordinate with stakeholders to align objectives, streamline project execution, and foster a problem-solving culture.




Essential Requirements:




 * Experience: 7+ years in program management or digital product management within technology-driven sectors, with demonstrated success managing complex, multi-team projects.
 * Technical Knowledge: Familiarity with IoT systems, cloud platforms, and renewable energy technologies, including security and resilience practices.
 * Communication Skills: Proven ability to convey technical concepts effectively to diverse audiences, ensuring alignment across organizational levels.
 * Problem-Solving: Strong analytical skills to identify risks, propose mitigation strategies, and drive continuous improvement.
 * Organizational Agility: Capacity to navigate and coordinate within complex, matrixed organizations with diverse teams and stakeholders.
 * This position offers the opportunity to contribute to transformative energy solutions, fostering sustainability and innovation in renewable energy technologies.
 * Candidates must have full right to work in Germany also be Fluent in English written and spoken, Knowledge of German is an advantage but not essential.

title: Product Owner (w/m/d)
description:
WEN WIR SUCHEN

Du willst unsere nächsten Produkterfolge mit deiner Leidenschaft für gute Software mitgestalten? Du arbeitest gerne agil und kannst mit einem hohen Grad an Eigenverantwortung umgehen?

Dann wollen wir dich als Product Owner (w/m/d)!

DEINE MISSION

Als Product Owner (w/m/d) arbeitest du in einem interdisziplinären Feature Team eng mit Design, UX und Development zusammen, darüber hinaus baust du dir ein Netzwerk mit Sales, Marketing und Customer Success auf.


 * Durch die Priorisierung des Backlogs und die Abstimmung mit den relevanten Stakeholdern (w/m/d) (z.B. Customer Success, Sales) treibst du die Produktentwicklung maßgeblich voran.
 * Mit deinem cross-funktionalen Team übersetzt du Bedürfnisse aus dem Markt und Anforderungen der Stakeholder (w/m/d) in User Stories und setzt diese agil um.
 * Zusammen mit UX entwickelst du die User Experience unserer Produkte weiter. Dazu erarbeitest du KPIs, Nutzungskennzahlen und Erfolgskriterien und definierst Maßnahmen zu deren Verbesserung.
 * Die Optimierung des agilen Arbeitens (z.B. Sprint Planning) gemeinsam mit deinem Team ist für dich eine Selbstverständlichkeit.
 * Bei unternehmensinternen Veranstaltungen repräsentierst du die Arbeit deines Teams (bspw. im Rahmen von Produkt-Demos).
 * Darüber hinaus erwarten dich weitere Herausforderungen aus dem Product Management, zum Beispiel arbeitest du an der langfristigen Produktstrategie, erstellst Markteinführungspläne, lieferst Input für die Marketing-Kommunikation und unterstützt Sales bei Kundenterminen.
   
   

DEINE EXPERTISE


 * Du konntest bereits zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung als Product Owner (w/m/d) sammeln.
 * Du kannst agile Methoden (z.B. SCRUM oder Kanban) im Arbeitsalltag praktisch anwenden.
 * Gestaltungsspielräume und Eigenverantwortung fordern dich heraus.
 * Du bist offen für den Dialog mit Kunden und hast gute Präsentationsfähigkeiten.
 * Du kommunizierst sicher auf Deutsch und Englisch.
   
   

UNSER ANGEBOT


 * Dein Arbeitsplatz: Büros im Herzen von Starnberg, unweit des Starnberger Sees & in der Nähe des Münchner Hirschgartens.
 * Hoher Gestaltungsspielraum: Unsere Flexibilität und Offenheit bieten dir die Chance, deine eigenen Ideen in die Projekte einfließen zu lassen - Entscheidungen werden schnell getroffen.
 * Umfangreiches Onboarding: Du bekommst einen Buddy an die Seite und durchläufst ein strukturiertes Onboarding.
 * estos-Spirit: Kurze Kommunikationswege, Du-Kultur und ein sehr dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld, das offen für Verbesserungen ist.
 * Vertrauen und Eigenständigkeit: Flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten mit viel Freiraum in der Arbeitszeiteinteilung sowie die Möglichkeit bis zu 10 Tage jährlich Workation innerhalb der EU.
   
   

DIE ECKDATEN

Standort: Starnberg, unweit des Starnberger Sees, sowie München Hirschgarten

Start: Ab sofort

Beschäftigungsart: Unbefristet in Vollzeit

Wir, die estos GmbH, sind Hersteller von Kommunikations-Software und innovativer Baustein für Unified Communications – in 2022 & 2023 ausgezeichnet als Top-100-Innovator! title: Digital Product Owner
description:
i2M is the global incubation and acceleration platform for digital products and business models of the MANN+HUMMEL Group. Our venture teams and entrepreneurs are focused on disruptive innovation and creating the next multi-million Euro business for MANN+HUMMEL. We work as a professional team in an agile setup. The digital products and services we create help to solve demanding challenges in the areas of clean air, clean water, and clean mobility. The team operates out of i2m GmbH and is located in Ludwigsburg.




For our Digital Hub Europe Team we are looking for an experienced and driven




Digital Product Owner (m/f/d)

 

to define and execute the product vision, align it with strategic business objectives, and ensure the delivery of valuable and customer-centric solutions.




YOUR RESPONSIBILITES:




 * Defining Product Vision and Strategy: Conduct market research, gather customer insights, and set a competitive product vision aligned with business goals.
 * Managing and Prioritizing the Product Backlog: Translate customer needs into actionable user stories and prioritize them effectively.
 * Providing Clear Acceptance Criteria: Define and communicate acceptance criteria for user stories, ensuring deliverables meet expectations.
 * Stakeholder Engagement: Build relationships with stakeholders, maintain transparency, and align their perspectives into a unified product vision.
 * Driving Customer-Centric Value Propositions: Develop and test value propositions with rigorous customer focus and validation.

 

YOUR PROFILE / REQUIREMENTS:




Education / Experience:

 * Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Computer Science required
 * Typically 7+ years or more of professional experience.
 * Experience around software engineering, analytics, artificial Intelligence.
 * Extensive experience as a Product Manager/Owner with ability to manage multiple projects and workstreams.
 * Proven ability to develop innovative products, streamline complex processes, and manage strategic roadmaps to drive project success.




Required Skills: 

 * Analytical Skills: Solve complex problems and make data-driven decisions.
 * Strategic Thinking and Planning: Align product vision with market trends and customer needs.
 * Communication and Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams and ensure alignment.
 * Customer Empathy: Understand customer needs and create user-centric solutions.
 * Data Analysis: Use data to inform decisions and track product success metrics.
 * Financial Acumen: Understand product-related financial concepts, including budgeting and pricing.
 * Agile Methodology: Experience with Scrum and Kanban practices.




WHY JOIN US?

At i2m, we are committed to fostering innovation, collaboration, and personal growth. You’ll have the opportunity to work on meaningful projects and make a real impact in shaping the future of our products.

 

INTERESTED?

We look forward to your e-mail application with an informative cover letter and CV jobs@i-2-m.eu

description:

What You Need To Surf The Wave With Us

 * You have basic knowledge of A/B testing, user research and app analytics and are eager to develop these skills further

Ready to surf?

We are looking forward to your application! If you have any questions, please drop a message to our recruiter Luca via team@roadsurfer.com.

ABOUT #ROADSURFER

As a #roadsurfer you are part of an open, fast-growing team with ambitious goals and a great team spirit. We stick together and combine a brutal hands-on mentality with fun at work! It means shaping the future of outdoor travel and building an ecosystem for sustainable outdoor travel. We are more than Europe's largest campervan rental company. In 2021 we launched our platform roadsurfer spots in addition to our other products rent, abo and sales – a platform where you can discover and book unique camping spots. But that’s only the beginning. We are growing fast, so hop on board and join us on our journey. We’re looking for motivated and passionate people whose hearts beat for campers. Wanna spread the roadsurfer spirit across the globe with us?

title: Product Owner (w/m/d)
description:
To accelerate the growth of German Mittelstand!






vent.io GmbH entwickelt als Unternehmen der Deutsche Leasing AG und Teil der Sparkasse Finanzgruppe digitale Geschäftsmodelle, Produkte und Services.






Wir suchen DICH als Product Owner (w/m/d) für eine Elternzeitvertretung - befristet auf ein Jahr - im Bereich Product Experience:






DAS ERWARTET DICH

Als Product Owner (w/m/d) im Team Product Experience (ProductX) bist Du der Antrieb hinter der Entwicklung verschiedener digitaler Produkte bei vent.io.




 * Du entwickelst passend zur Strategie der Deutsche Leasing Gruppe geeignete digitale Produkte und definierst in enger Absprache mit dem Managing Director und dem CTO die Umsetzungs-Roadmap für die einzelnen Produkte
 * Du bist in alle Produktentwicklungsphasen involviert – von der Anforderungsdefinition über die Analyse und das Design bis hin zur Implementierung, dem Test und der Einführung, mit dem Ziel, die beste User Experience zu gestalten
 * Du stehst im aktiven Austausch mit unseren Kunden, verstehst ihre Bedürfnisse und übersetzt sie in ein Produktbacklog, den Du verwaltest und priorisierst
 * Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Engineering-Teams zusammen, um sicherzustellen, dass die Produktentwicklung gemäß den definierten Anforderungen und Zeitplänen erfolgt
 * Du förderst die experimentelle Natur unserer Engineering-Teams und unterstützt den Innovationsauftrag
 * Du betreibst aktives Stakeholder-Management und kommunizierst fortlaufend, sowohl mit unseren Kunden als auch mit unseren Engineering-Teams und bist daher das entscheidende Bindeglied zwischen Business, Methodik und Technologie sowie auch die Schnittstelle zwischen Product Management, UX/UI Designer und Engineering Teams




DAS BRINGST DU MIT

 * Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder Mediendesign mit Schwerpunkt auf digitalem Design
 * Du bist zusätzlich zu Deinem abgeschlossenen Studium im Idealfall ein zertifizierter CSPO (Certified Scrum Product Owner) oder PSPO (Professional Scrum Product Owner)

title: Junior Product Owner (d/f/m)
description:
About

Bei RISK IDENT ist es unser Ziel, unseren Kunden die beste Entscheidungsgrundlage geben zu können, ob es sich bei ihren Transaktionen um vertrauenswürdige oder betrügerische handelt. Zu diesem Zweck haben wir FRIDA entwickelt. Eine Software, die alle relevanten Daten zusammenfasst, Verbindungen erkennt und mit Hilfe von regelbasierten und ML Modellen das Risiko von Transaktionen bewertet.

Dieser Aufgabe stellen wir uns mit zwei crossfunktionalen, internen Entwicklungsteams, die in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Projektverantwortlichen, Betrugsexpert*innen und Data Scientists dafür kämpfen, den Betrüger*innen immer einen Schritt voraus zu sein. Dabei stehen die FRIDA Teams vor der Herausforderung, Anforderungen aus vielen verschiedenen Quellen zu filtern und zu vereinen, um den Mehrwert für unsere Kunden zu maximieren. Das machen wir, indem wir komplexe Sachverhalte schnell und verständlich aufbereiten und die Nutzer*innen unserer Software befähigen, schnell und gezielt reagieren zu können.

Tasks


 * Analyse und Erhebung von Anforderungen im engen Austausch mit Kunden, Product Ownern, Fachabteilungen und Entwicklungsteams
 * Strukturierte Dokumentation und detaillierte Spezifizierung der Anforderungen in Form von Epics, User Stories und Akzeptanzkriterien
 * Unterstützung bei der Planung und Priorisierung von Produkt-Backlogs in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Product Owner
 * Sicherstellung der Nachvollziehbarkeit und Testbarkeit von Anforderungen
 * Durchführung von Workshops und Anforderungsanalysen mit internen und externen Stakeholdern
 * Dokumentation und Übersetzungen der entwickelten Funktionalitäten in Form von User Manuals
 * Erstellen von Mock Ups zur Visualisierung der Anforderungen für die Entwicklungsteams
   
   

Requirements


 * Du hast Erfahrung als Refinement Engineer, Projekt Manager oder Product Owner, idealerweise im Bereich E-Commerce, Payment oder Credit Risk / Fraud Prevention
 * Du bist motiviert, dich schnell in neue Themen einzuarbeiten
 * Du bringst Erfahrung in der Erhebung und Analyse und Dokumentation von Anforderungen in agilen Projekten mit
 * Du verfügst über fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
 * Du hast eine ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und ein hohes Maß an Kundenorientierung
 * Von Vorteil sind Kenntnisse in Software zur Anforderungsverwaltung (z.B. JIRA, Confluence), sowie basic UX Fähigkeiten
   
   

We Offer The Following Benefits


 * Großzügige Richtlinie zum mobilen Arbeiten mit Schwerpunkt auf Abstimmung im Team
 * Zuschuss zum Mittagessen in Höhe von 30,- € pro Monat
 * Zuschuss zum Deutschlandticket (mit dem du alle öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel in ganz Deutschland nutzen kannst) in Höhe von 19,-€ pro Monat
 * Fahrrad-Leasingprogramm über JobRad mit Versicherungszuschuss
 * Interne Coaching und Trainingsangebote (unsere internen Coaches können auch für nicht-Arbeitsthemen in Anspruch genommen werden)
 * Innovation Days zur persönlichen Weiterentwicklung
 * Zugang zu zwei digitalen Lernplattformen (Udemy und Masterplan) und Budget für externe Konferenzen, Trainings, etc.
 * Bezahlte Social Days für ehrenamtliche Arbeit an deinem Herzensprojekt
 * Mental Health Initiativen
 * Freie Wahl zwischen Windows, Linux oder MacOS auf einer leistungsstarken mobilen Hardware und alles weitere, was du zum effizienten Arbeiten benötigst
 * Übernahme der Reisekosten zu Firmenevents bis zu 4x im Jahr für Riskies von außerhalb Hamburgs
 * Attraktive Rabatte bei verschiedenen Partnern und Fitnessstudios, z.B. 15% Rabatt auf www.otto.de oder 10% Rabatt bei Fitness First
 * Zugang zur Plattform "Corporate Benefits" der Otto Group, die Rabatte bei verschiedensten Partner gewährt (Deko, Reisen, Autovermietung, etc.)
 * Im Office in Hamburg: kostenlose Getränke aller Art und Bio-Obst, das zweimal pro Woche geliefert wird
 * Dusche im Büro, sodass du z.B. aktive Mittagspausen oder einen Arbeitsweg mit dem Fahrrad problemlos in deinen Arbeitstag integrieren kannst
 * Möglichkeit, nach 3 Jahren Beschäftigung ein Sabbatical zu nehmen
   
   

Wenn du dich bewerben möchtest, nutze bitte den unten stehenden Bewerber-Button. Deine Bewerbungsunterlagen sollten Folgendes enthalten:


 * Deinen Lebenslauf (im PDF Format)
 * Ein Motivationsschreiben (im PDF Format) das deutlich macht, warum du gern bei RISK IDENT arbeiten möchtest und welcher der oben genannten Bereiche dich interessiert
 * Deine Gehaltsvorstellung
   
   

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung! Deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Jana Gilb (Director People & Culture).

About Us

RISK IDENT is a dynamic software development company based in Hamburg, Germany. Founded in 2012, our team became one of the market leaders within fraud prevention in the German speaking market in a very short period of time. Today, as an independent company within the OTTO Group RISK IDENT has a strong customer base, the majority of our customers coming from e-commerce, telecommunications, mobility and financial services. We secure more than 80 billion euros of annual turnover against fraud for our customers. We have an innovative SaaS business model with an excellent market position. Our team consists of around 80 people from all over the world with every single one of them loving what they do. We are always on the lookout for new challenges and for smart people to accompany us along the way!

title: Product Owner
description:
The Hornetsecurity Group is the leading cloud security provider in Europe, which protects the IT infrastructure, digital communication and data of companies and organizations of all sizes.

For our location in Hannover (List) we are looking for a motivated Product Owner (m/f/d) for 40 hours/week to start immediately or as soon as possible!

Tasks


 * You act as the primary point of contact between stakeholders and product squads.
 * You create and maintain a well-defined product backlog, ensuring it is properly prioritized and ready for sprint planning.
 * You triage and prioritize feature requests, improvements, and bug fixes.
 * You write clear, detailed user stories and acceptance criteria for product squads.
 * You collaborate closely with product squads in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and sprint reviews.
 * You make quick, informed decisions to keep development moving forward.
 * You ensure delivered features meet quality standards and align with the product vision.
 * You collaborate with UX/UI designers to create delightful user experiences.
 * You work with other Product Managers and Product Owners to improve product management practices, resolve dependencies, and remove obstacles to feature delivery.
 * You create and maintain all product documentation required for the delivery of product features according to the software development lifecycle process.
 * You partner with customer-facing teams to ensure smooth product adoption and address user concerns.
   
   
   

Requirements


 * You have a degree in computer science
 * You have a first experience as a Product Owner for B2B or B2C software
 * You enjoy solving complex problems in a collaborative manner
 * Your peers praise you for your organization, attention to detail, autonomy, team spirit and sense of responsibility
 * You are keen to expose yourself to new technologies and ideas.
 * You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.
   
   
   

Would be a plus:


 * You have already used Atlassian Confluence and Jira.
 * You have experience with the Gherkin syntax
 * You are fluent in German or French
   
   
   

Benefits


 * Free space for innovation and independent action in a fast-growing international company.
 * Short decision paths and flat hierarchies in an open work atmosphere.
 * Extensive Onboarding – we equip you with a welcome kit, 2 days Onboarding Bootcamp, Mentoring Program and regular feedback meetings.
 * Temporary Employee Exchange Program – we provide the ability for you to work at our global office locations and explore the world (e.g. Berlin, Madrid, Malta, Montréal, Washington D.C.).
 * Home-office-option and flexible working time.
 * Unlimited contracts: we’re looking for hornets to grow long-term with us.
 * Be-Active Bonus: we’ll keep you healthy with an allowance for your membership in fitness and sports clubs.
 * Referral Bonus: we pay 1500€ for each referral who is successfully hired by us!
 * Office Dogs are welcome – you don’t have to leave your dog alone at home!
 * Team events like Laser Tag, Office Movie Nights, Foodie Fridays and much more – let yourself be surprised.
   
   
   

Do you want to help us shape the future of Cyber Security? Apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile.

title: Product Owner
description:
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Product Owner at Xsolla. You will be responsible for driving the development, enhancement, and delivery of scalable solutions to optimize game sales for our partners. The ideal candidate will combine technical acumen with business expertise, ensuring the product’s success in a fast-paced, international environment and should be someone who is well versed in game peculiarities of the markets of various regions (USA, Asia, EU).

Solid experience in successfully launching and managing sales of digital products on gaming platforms, deep understanding of game monetization mechanisms and in-game goods and having professional contacts in the industry and understanding of its ecosystem as well as having worked in a game producing capacity will be key to your success in this role.

If you are passionate about supporting developers in bringing their games to market, data driven and able to make decisions based on available data, selling digital products and in-game goods, then we would love to hear from you!

Responsibilities


 * Identify the needs of new users and work with current users of the product
 * Continuously monitor trends and changes in the gaming market, responding in a timely manner and adjusting sales strategies for the solution accordingly
 * Gather insights about customer segment expectations through market research and feedback from partners
 * Educate internal Business Development and Account Management teams on the Game Sales solution
 * Align on strategy and tactics with customer segment expectations
 * Provide guidance to the teams in aligning their decisions with customer expectations
 * Track the development of the market and offer options for product development
 * Form and maintain a product development roadmap
 * Keep up to date and prioritize tasks in the product backlog
 * Communicate the product development strategy to the team
 * Be part of a product development team and participate in building a product culture
 * Identify and minimize product development risks, discuss risks with the team and Stakeholders
 * Initialize and directly participate in interviews with the target audience
 * Work on product metrics improvement
 * Data-driven / experiment-driven backlog management experience
   
   
   

Team Management:


 * Create a team from scratch (onboarding, retaining)
 * Support the professional growth of employees through the accumulation of knowledge and experience.
 * Work with the strengths and weaknesses of team members.
 * Build a culture of collective responsibility for commitment.
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Experience as a Product Owner / Product Manager / Game Producer 5+ years.
 * 5+ years experience in the video game development industry.
 * Excellent understanding of the management and approach to monetization in F2P and B2P games.
 * Deep understanding of PC publishing (F2P/B2P games) and passionate about the video game industry.
 * Experience with digital distribution platforms such as Steam, GOG, Epic Games Store and others, including setting up and managing sales on these platforms.
 * Knowledge of various marketing approaches and distribution channels to attract and retain users.
 * Experience of interaction with Business Development specialists.
 * Knowledge and understanding of the processes of selling digital products and in-game goods.
 * Excellent analytical skills, ability to work with data and make decisions based on it
 * Product presale experience.
 * Pitching experience.
 * Significant experience in developing financial models.
 * Stakeholder management experience.
 * Experience with product marketing.
 * Leadership and ability to lead a team.
 * Upper-intermediate level of English or higher.
 * Understand and apply agile product management methodologies like Scrum and Agile.
 * Ability to work and be flexible in a fast pace environment.
   
   
   

Nice to haves:


 * You are well versed in the game peculiarities of the markets of various regions (USA, Asia, Europe).
 * Experience in successfully launching and managing sales of digital products on gaming platforms.
 * Deep understanding of game monetization mechanisms and in-game goods.
 * Having professional contacts in the industry and understanding of its ecosystem.
 * Worked in Game Producer position.
 * Experience in E-commerce.
 * Understanding of ethics regarding monetization and advertising in games, including issues of addiction and manipulation.
 * Experience of work with Salesforce.
   
   
   

Don’t meet every requirement listed? Studies show that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs when they don’t meet every requirement. At Xsolla, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive community, so if you think you could be amazing in this role, even without all the listed qualifications, please apply! You may be exactly who we didn’t even know we needed.

At Xsolla, we are passionate about providing a conducive environment for our team to thrive personally and professionally. Our Benefits Program caters to the physical, mental, and emotional well-being of our full-time employees.

Understanding the detrimental effects of burnout, we offer unlimited Flexible Time Off and 28 paid holidays each year. Personal and professional development is a cornerstone of our ethos at Xsolla. Each employee has a personalized career roadmap, developed in partnership with their manager, aligning individual and company goals. We support this growth through in-house training, independent study, conference attendance, and higher education opportunities.

About Us

At Xsolla, we believe that great games begin as ideas, driven by the curiosity, dedication, and grit of creators around the world. Our mission is to empower these visionaries by providing the support and resources they need to bring their games to life. We are committed to leveling the playing field, ensuring that every creator has the opportunity to share their passion with the world. Headquartered in Los Angeles, with offices in Berlin, Seoul, and beyond, we partner with industry leaders like Valve, Twitch, and Ubisoft to clear the paths for innovation in gaming. Our global reach spans over 200 geographies, offering more than 700 payment methods in 130+ currencies.

Headquartered and incorporated in Los Angeles, California, with offices in Berlin, Seoul, Beijing, Kuala Lumpur, and cities around the world, Xsolla supports major gaming titles like Valve, Twitch, Roblox, Ubisoft, Epic Games, KRAFTON, Nexters, NetEase, Playstudios, Playrix, miHoYo, Pearl Abyss, NCSoft, and more.

By submitting the following job application form, you consent to Xsolla processing your data for career-related inquiries and potential employment opportunities. We process your data in accordance with this Xsolla Privacy Notice for Job Applicants . Please direct any inquiries regarding GDPR or CCPA to careers@xsolla.com

title: SaaS Product Owner (m/w/d)
description:
ilert helps companies to respond faster to incidents and increase the availability of digital services. Our mission is to keep the world always on. Customers from all industries worldwide rely on ilert for alerting, on-call management, and incident communication. We address a fundamental need of companies that offer 24/7 services.

We are seeking a dedicated Product Owner to join our team. In this role, you will work closely with our CEO - who currently leads product strategy - to translate the product vision into actionable tasks for our engineering team. Your primary focus will be on managing the product backlog, creating detailed user stories, and ensuring that our development efforts align with customer needs and business objectives.

Tasks

Backlog Management


 * Own and prioritize the product backlog based on the product roadmap and strategic goals.
 * Ensure transparency of the backlog items to all stakeholders.
   
   
   

User Story Development


 * Write clear, concise user stories with well-defined acceptance criteria.
 * Break down complex features into manageable tasks for the engineering team.
   
   
   

Sprint Planning and Execution


 * Collaborate with the engineering team during sprint planning to define goals and deliverables.
 * Take ownership of our sprint planning meeting
   
   
   

Stakeholder Communication


 * Act as the primary liaison between the CEO (product strategy) and the engineering team.
 * Provide regular updates on development progress and gather feedback.
   
   
   

Quality Assurance


 * Validate completed work against acceptance criteria and ensure it meets the product’s quality standards.
 * Facilitate user acceptance testing and incorporate feedback into future sprints.
   
   
   

Process Improvement


 * Continuously evaluate and improve product development processes.
 * Implement best practices in our development process
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field.
 * Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Product Owner or similar role in a SaaS environment.
 * Proven track record of managing software products from conception to launch.
   
   
   

Skills


 * Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and their core principles
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 * Ability to translate high-level product ideas into detailed technical requirements.
 * Proficiency with product management tools
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
   
   
   

Attributes:


 * Highly organized with excellent time management abilities.
 * Collaborative mindset with the ability to work cross-functionally.
 * Customer-focused attitude with a keen eye for detail.
   
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Experience in a B2B SaaS company, especially in the DevOps sector.
 * Familiarity with incident response, alerting systems, or related technologies.
 * Technical background or experience working closely with software development teams.
   
   
   

Benefits


 * Product-centric culture: Be part of a team that's 100% committed to solving a critical issue for businesses that offer round-the-clock services.
 * Hybrid Work Environment: Enjoy the best of both worlds with in-person collaboration and remote work flexibility.
 * No Meetings #hackfwd: Maximize productivity by keeping meetings to a minimum and focusing on your core responsibilities.
 * Lean and Scrappy By Design: Join a close-knit community that values open communication, mutual support, and shared goals.
 * Managers of One & Autonomy: Embrace a flat organizational structure and take full ownership of your work, driving your success.

 * Regular team events

title: Technical Product Owner Fulfillment
description:
Job Summary:




Teveo is seeking a dedicated and experienced Technical Product Owner for our fulfillment systems. In this role, you will be responsible for managing, maintaining, and enhancing key applications that are critical to our organization’s operations. You will act as a bridge between business departments and IT, ensuring that application functionalities align with business needs and that any issues are swiftly resolved. Your technical expertise, combined with strong communication and problem-solving skills, will be essential in collaborating with software vendors and internal teams to implement and manage interfaces and integrations. If you have a strong background in IT projects, particularly within eCommerce environments, and are passionate about driving solutions, we invite you to join our team.




Key Responsibilities:




 * Application Ownership: Manage and take full responsibility for all applications related to the entire fulfillment process, encompassing areas from warehouse management to customer service. Understand how these applications are used, the problems they solve, and their functionality.
 * Requirements Alignment: Collaborate with business departments to align application requirements and ensure they meet business needs.
 * Vendor Collaboration: Work closely with software vendors to implement new requirements and enhancements.
 * Integration Management: Partner with IT teams to realize and maintain interfaces between fulfillment applications and other systems.
 * Problem Solving: Address and resolve any issues related to the applications, ensuring smooth operation and minimal downtime.
 * Documentation and Training: Maintain thorough documentation of application configurations and processes. Provide training and support to end-users as needed.




Qualifications:




 * Experience: Several years of experience in IT projects, ideally within an eCommerce environment, including both organizational and practical involvement (e.g., through configuration) in projects or application maintenance.
 * Technical Skills: Willingness to get hands-on with software configuration; Nice to have: Proficient in ETL processes and APIs and ability of writing small REST/SOAP queries for a proof of concept.
 * Basic Logistics Knowledge: Understanding of logistics processes and concepts.
 * Work Ethic: Demonstrates an independent, solution-oriented, and team-oriented work style, with a proven track record in managing large software projects.
 * Communication Skills: Excellent communication skills, enjoying the coordination of multiple internal and external stakeholders.
 * Language Proficiency: Fluent in both German and English, with strong written and verbal communication skills in both languages.




What We Offer:




 * Competitive salary and benefits package.
 * Remote work options*.
 * Opportunities for professional growth and development.
 * A dynamic and inclusive work environment within a young team.
 * Regular employee events.
 * Employee discounts in our shops.




*Given the location-specific nature of our fulfillment systems, a willingness to be present on-site as required is essential in order to analyze, understand, and resolve any issues that may arise.




If you are passionate about managing critical applications within an organization and thrive in a dynamic environment, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and cover letter including your salary expectations and possible starting date.




Please note in making your application that we are looking for someone in remote who can be on site at our headquarter about two days a month.

title: Freelance - Pimcore Product Owner [w/m/x] - remote
description:
Aufgaben: Entsprechen unserer permanent Besetzung zur vorübergehenden Überbrückung und/oder Übernahme einzelner interner Projekte:

Ownership, also die Fähigkeit, ein Produkt an sich zu nehmen, es “zu ownen” und damit die Verantwortung für den Business Value zu übernehmen, ihn zu schärfen, stetig zu verbessern und immer wieder zu hinterfragen, ist eine großartige Herausforderung. Wir haben Lust auf Ownership! Du auch?

Manche da draußen verwechseln Agilität mit Flexibilität und haben keine Ahnung, dass ein agiler Softwareentwicklungsprozess jede Menge Disziplin erfordert. Manche sagen Scrum und machen chaotischen Wasserfall. Wir nicht.

Wir sind selbst Techies, über 50 % unseres Teams sind Entwickler:innen. Wir brauchen POs auf technischer Augenhöhe. Du entwickelst mit deinem Team inhouse und nah am Code.

Unsere Projekte könnten unterschiedlicher nicht sein: ein Omnichannel-B2B-E-Commerce-Projekt in Scrum für einen großen Online-Retailer, eine hochkomplexe Multi-Datenbank-Applikation für ein führendes deutsches Verlagshaus im Customer-Success-Team oder eine komplette Digital-Experience-Plattform für einen Weltmarktführer im Braugewerbe. Genau diese Abwechslung macht uns Spaß, lässt uns über den Tellerrand schauen und bringt dabei spannende neue Dinge hervor, die wir dann in den unterschiedlichsten Branchen und Projekten einsetzen.

Das geht nur mit Transparenz, Vertrauen und Leidenschaft. Eben mit Ownership!

Aufgaben

Deine Mission und dein Team

Für die technische Umsetzung der Anforderungen unserer langjährigen Kunden, aber auch für neuere Projekte suchen wir ab sofort und in Vollzeit mehrere (Senior) Technical Product Owner [w/m/x]. Gemeinsam mit deinem Team aus interdisziplinären Expert:innen und Entwickler:innen sorgst du dafür, dass das Projekt erfolgreich implementiert wird, fungierst als Ansprechpartner:in für alle Stakeholder, bist tief im Backlog und maximierst den Wert und die Qualität des Produktes innerhalb des Scopes und der Timebox.


 * Du fungierst als technische:r Sparringspartner:in für alle Stakeholder und bist die Schnittstelle (PPO) zwischen Kunden und Entwickler:innen-Team.
 * Du arbeitest dich in die technischen Voraussetzungen des Projekts ein, identifizierst die Anforderungen und Zielsetzungen des Kunden an das Projekt und unterstützt das Team dabei, die Anforderungen umzusetzen.
 * Übernahme aller Aufgaben eines Product Owners nach Scrum: wie beispielsweise das Stakeholder-Management, Anforderungs-Management, Backlog-Arbeit, Durchführung von Reviews, Refinements und Retros in Zusammenarbeit mit deinem Scrum-Team
 * Du verantwortest das Projekt-Controlling und dokumentierst deinen Projektverlauf.
 * Du bist für den Erfolg des Projektes zuständig und planst die Team-Ressourcen und -Kapazitäten, um den reibungslosen Ablauf sicherzustellen.
   
   

Qualifikation

Das bringst du mit (je nach deiner Seniorität)


 * Mehrjährige Erfahrung als Product Owner im Bereich der agilen Softwareentwicklung und idealerweise auch in der technischen Umsetzung von Datenbankprojekten und technischen Applikationen (PIM-/DAM- und MDM-Systeme).
 * Expert:innen-Kenntnisse in der Entwicklung von User Stories sowie im Aufbau und in der Priorisierung und Pflege des Backlogs
 * Du verfügst über Kommunikationsstärke, um unsere Kunden erfolgreich durch das Projekt zu führen
 * Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie eine gültige EU-Arbeitserlaubnis
 * Du hast einen Abschluss in bspw. Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Informatik oder Ingenieurwissenschaften
 * Du verfügst über eine strukturierte und analytische Arbeitsweise und bist in der Lage, komplexe Sachverhalte zielgruppengerecht an die Stakeholder zu vermitteln.
   
   

Benefits


 * Echtes Scrum, kein Bullshit
 * Ein Team von interdisziplinären Expert:innen, die Lust auf Ownership haben
 * Technische Challenges und Sparringspartner
 * Flexible Arbeitszeiten, auch kompatibel für Kids und Family
 * Arbeite 100 % remote, wenn Du magst − bei 0 % Distanz, versprochen
 * Lust auf Workation? Do it!
 * Persönliches Weiterbildungsbudget, um an Trainings, Workshops und Events teilzunehmen
 * Du bist Basilicom. Gestalte dein Arbeitsumfeld und deine Agentur mit
 * Finde bei uns deine neuen Arbeitsfreund:innen
 * Regelmäßige hauseigene Events, Meet-ups und viele Teamausflüge ins Grüne
 * Moderne Hard- und Software zum Arbeiten
 * Kulinarische Leckerbissen im Dienstags-Lunch, Basics jederzeit aus dem Kühlschrank
 * Wir lieben unsere Büros, komm vorbei und besuch uns
 * Verbieg dich nicht, come as you are!
   
   

Bitte beachten: Wir freuen uns über direkte Bewerbungen von Kandidaten. Personaldienstleister bitten wir höflich, von telefonischen Kontaktaufnahmen abzusehen.

Wir sind Basilicom. Als Digitalagentur unterstützen wir Unternehmen strategisch und technisch bei der Umsetzung ihrer Digitalprojekte. Wir schaffen Plattformen für PIM, E-Commerce und Customer Experience. Wir sind Pimcore Agentur Nr. 1 in Deutschland.

Interesse an weiteren Informationen zu unserer Mission, unseren Werten und unseren Projekten? Bewirb dich jetzt unkompliziert bei uns oder melde Dich gerne direkt bei Kolja, unserem Recruiting Manager, unter +49 30 / 69 5660 7346.

title: Product Owner (m/f/x)
description:
Who You Will Work For:

Makersite is an award-winning data software company that empowers teams to manage product sustainability, cost, and compliance; simultaneously, from a web browser. Our mission is to help manufacturing companies make better decisions and create safer, more sustainable products through data-driven analysis. We believe that technology can help corporations to have a more positive impact on their environment. That is why we developed a platform that uses cutting-edge technology, big data, and breakthrough algorithms to deliver product intelligence, unlike anything on the market.

For manufacturing companies with complex supply chains that want to accelerate product development, build resilience or reduce costs, Makersite is a disruptive digital twin platform that uses AI to connect and enrich cross-departmental data into live models for analysis, collaboration and decision support. Digital twins can be used to understand how externalities like regulations, supply shortages etc. affect a business and help teams evaluate scenarios considering multiple criteria like costs, environment, compliance etc. at the same time.

Who We Are Looking For:

We are seeking a Product Owner to join our team and bring clarity, guidance, and expertise to our product development efforts. If you're passionate about solving complex problems, collaborating with talented teams, and driving impactful results, this is the role for you.

What You Will Do:

Define and Communicate Product Goals: Establish and maintain clear product objectives aligned with business strategy and ensure they are communicated effectively to all stakeholders.

Own the Product Backlog: Develop, prioritize, and communicate the product backlog to ensure it reflects the needs of the business and users.

Provide Contextual Guidance: Leverage your domain expertise to provide the development team with contextual guidance, ensuring they understand what they are building and why.

Collaborate with Key Stakeholders: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, and business stakeholders, to ensure alignment and transparency.

Navigate Uncertainty: Thrive in a fast-paced environment with a high degree of uncertainty, balancing competing priorities and making decisions with incomplete information.

Drive Transparency: Establish processes to keep all stakeholders informed of progress, priorities, and trade-offs.

Your Impact:

You will address critical gaps in capacity within our teams and provide the domain-specific expertise needed to guide our product development. Your leadership will ensure the clarity and focus needed to drive product success in a fast-moving and complex environment.

Top Challenges:

Managing high levels of uncertainty in a fast-paced and ever-evolving landscape.

Developing a deep understanding of complex domains (sustainability, supply chain, and B2B SaaS) in a short time frame.

Balancing priorities and making strategic sacrifices to achieve long-term goals.

Differentiating the role of Product Ownership from project management and staying focused on delivering value.


 * 2+ years of consultancy experience, demonstrating strong problem-solving and stakeholder management skills.
 * Expertise in B2B SaaS software, with a proven track record of delivering impactful products.
 * Educational background or work experience in supply chain or sustainability domains.
 * Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment and prioritize competing demands.
 * Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to articulate complex ideas clearly.
   
   

What You Can Expect From Us:


 * Belonging - Be part of the sustainability megatrend
 * Development – a steep learning-curve, both personally and professionally
 * Pride - Do amazing work with an international, vibrant and passionate top-class team.
 * Passion - International customers that love what we do and share our vision.
 * Remote Working - Work 100% remote if you like (in the EU)
 * Values-driven culture - we're proud of our culture.
 * Time-Off - 30 days of paid time off per year.
 * Technology – State-of-the-art equipment.
 * Competitive salary
   
   

What To Expect When You Apply

If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you! We look forward to receiving your detailed CV together with a cover letter. If it’s a match, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

We try to keep the process short and sweet, to welcome you at Makersite as soon as possible!

Support – If you have a medical condition or an individual need for an adjustment to our process, and you believe this may affect your ability to beat at your best – please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support you and make any adjustments that may be needed

So, What Does It Really Mean to Work at Makersite?

At Makersite, we come together with a shared purpose to help companies around the world improve their products, so they are more successful while being mindful of their customers and the environment. Therefore, we believe everyone deserves to work in a collaborative, open-minded and inspiring environment. We work hard to make sure everyone has the support they need to thrive. Our 3 core values are diversity, purpose and collaboration:

We believe that good ideas come from anywhere. We embrace diversity and look for team members who have different skills but similar values.

We want to make a significant impact on the take, make, waste economy of today. We believe that technology can provide solutions that enable this and work hard to make our ideas a reality.

No politics, no drama, no slacking. We believe in technology-enabled collaboration. Whether you are working remotely or in our offices, you will always find someone to help you.

Equal Opportunity Statement

At Makersite, we're committed to cultivating an environment that promotes diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging. We believe that diverse teams are the best teams and we're proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We welcome and will consider all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage, pregnancy, maternity, race or nationality, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation (and any other status protected by applicable law).

All applications will be treated in strictest confidence

 * Affinität zu unserem Tech Stack (PHP, Laravel, React, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker) ist hilfreich.
 * Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.




Gestalte die Zukunft der Verwaltung mit uns!




Ob Berufseinsteiger oder erfahrener Product Owner – bei uns kannst du deine Ideen einbringen und die Entwicklung zukunftsweisender IT-Lösungen mitgestalten. Wenn du die digitale Transformation des öffentlichen Sektors aktiv vorantreiben möchtest, freuen wir uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen!

title: Junior Product Owner (m/w/d) Customer Engagement
description:

Über diesen Job

Die CHECK24 Factory ist die Zentraleinheit von CHECK24, die Lösungen für alle Verticals (unsere Produktsparten) konzipiert und umsetzt. Als Ideenfabrik arbeiten wir täglich daran, die beste Customer Journey für unsere Kunden im Kundekonto zu schaffen.Du hast Dein Masterstudium erfolgreich abgeschlossen und möchtest ein Creator of IMPACT werden. Werde als Junior Product Owner (m/w/d) Customer Engagement bei der CHECK24 Factory GmbH Teil eines All-Star-Teams aus IT und Produktmanagement und gestalte gemeinsam die Zukunft von CHECK24.

Zu Deinen Aufgaben zählen


 * Du treibst Innovations- und Produktentwicklungsprozesse im CHECK24 Kundenkonto voran, einschließlich des CHECK24 Punkte Programms, und optimierst das Kundenkonto sowie das Loyalitätsprogramm unter Einsatz neuer Technologien wie AI

 * Du analysierst die Kunden- und Nutzeranforderungen und kennst die aktuellen Trends, führst Markt- und Wettbewerbsanalysen durch, bewertest diese und äußerst klar Präferenzen
 * Deine Ergebnisse stellst Du wöchentlich den CHECK24 Gründern und Geschäftsführern vor und berätst sie zu operativen und strategischen Entscheidungen
   
   
   
   

Damit Du Dir unseren Arbeitsalltag besser vorstellen kannst, hier einige unserer typischen Fragestellungen:


 * Wie würdest Du neue Features im Kundenkonto entwickeln, um die Kundenloyalität zu steigern?
 * Welche technologischen Trends und Features siehst Du aktuell auf dem Markt bei BDPs und wie würdest Du diese in unsere Strategie einbinden?
 * Wie gehst Du mit komplexen Problemstellungen bei der Produktentwicklung um und welche innovativen Lösungsansätze würdest Du verfolgen?
 * Wie können wir das CHECK24 Punkte Programm weiterentwickeln, um die Kundenbindung zu stärken?
 * Welche Prozesse können wir noch verbessern, indem wir KI und modernste Technologien einsetzen, um unsere Kunden noch zufriedener zu machen?
   
   
   
   

Was wir Dir bieten


 * Wir bringen Dich voran: Du lernst täglich Neues durch Deine Arbeit mit erfahrenen Product Ownern und der IT. Wir fördern Deine Karriere individuell durch eigene für unsere Produktmanager konzipierte Trainings wie bspw. die Vertiefung Deiner IT-Skills, Prozessoptimierung oder im UX-Bereich
 * Umfeld, das Offenheit und Lernbereitschaft fordert und fördert: Du übernimmst von Anfang an Verantwortung in Deinem Team. Wenn Deine Ideen unsere Produkte besser machen, übernehmen wir sie. Du kennst ein Tool, das uns als Team besser macht? Wir führen es gemeinsam mit Dir ein
 * Modernes Arbeiten: Bis zu 40 Tage bezahlter Urlaub. Du erhältst 28 Tage Urlaub und darüber hinaus kannst Du wählen zwischen Home Office am Freitag oder bis zu 12 zusätzlichen Urlaubstagen. Auch eine Anpassung Deines Arbeitszeitmodells auf individuelle Bedürfnisse ist jederzeit möglich

Unser umfangreiches Getränkeangebot sowie frisches Obst sorgen für Energie und 2x pro Woche gibt es ein kostenloses Mittagessen durch unser Catering. Wir leben die Duz-Kultur mit kollegialem und freundschaftlichem Umfeld
 * Wir sind auch neben der Arbeit ein super Team: Bei uns herrscht ein kollegiales und freundschaftliches Umfeld. Bei Office Partys, Afterwork Get-together und unseren legendären Sommer- und Weihnachtsevents feiern wir unsere Erfolge

title: E-Commerce Product Owner (m/w/x)
description:
Wir denken nicht in festen Rollten, sondern in Anforderungen. Das heißt, du kannst bei uns eine sehr zentrale Rolle im Team einnehmen und dein Team dabei unterstützen, das bestmögliche Ergebnis für den Kunden abzuliefern. Benefits

What we expect

With your knowledge of software products and modern software architecture, you will steer software development into a successful future.

What you can contribute


 * Educational background and/or work experience in software development, especially in product offerings that are built to be used by software developers (e.g. cloud services).

 * Strong team and communication skills.
 * Self-motivated, structured and independent way of working.
 * Fluent English language skills (written and spoken).
   
   

What we are offering

We recognize their importance in fostering innovation, continuous learning, and industry connections, so we provide time and resources for these activities.

Since dogs are an integral part of our work environment they are also welcome in our offices. title: Product Owner (m/f/d) - Berlin
description:
The simple way to live safely.

We are Patronus.

We are more than just a provider of smart emergency watches. We are true visionaries.

As a modern healthtech start-up from Berlin with strong investors behind us, we are determined to improve the everyday lives of elderly people around the world, to make it safer and more independent.

title: Technical Product Owner (d/f/m)
description:
WHAT IS WORKING AT BETTERMILE LIKE?


 * We mean it when we say “cutting edge” and have a high level of creational freedom in our everyday work.
 * You will be surrounded by like-minded, driven, skilled, and highly motivated people who are keen to contribute to successful solutions.
 * We mean diversity, and we put it in numbers: 100+ people, 33 languages, 41% female (vs. ø26% in the tech industry), ø33 years of age, and yes, we do have Schlager-Fans among us.
 * We have a very supportive and appreciative working environment with a lot of autonomy, a flat hierarchy, and professional growth possibilities.
 * We work in a hybrid mode, with weekly team days for better collaboration and nurturing interpersonal connections. When onsite, we work in a modern, kid- and pet-friendly Better Space in the heart of Berlin-Kreuzberg.
 * Remote work from anywhere for up to 12 weeks in total per year.
 * 30 vacation days in a 5-day/week working model.
 * Kindergarten grant and a Company Pension scheme.
 * Regular team breakfasts, fitness & wellness classes, company runs, and other events. Fruits, snacks, drinks, and coffee with a variety of milk are a given - but yes, we have them.
 * Outstanding flexibility we are proud of – and, of course, the best colleagues in the world!
   
   
   

About the team - Better Places:

We are currently looking for a highly skilled and motivated Technical Product Owner to join the dynamic team at Bettermile. In this role, you will have a crucial responsibility in supporting the team that maintains a geocoding API composed of multiple backend services written in Kotlin and using various databases. Identifying potential causes of issues through data analysis is also part of the daily work. As a Technical Product Owner, you will primarily collaborate with engineers, QA teams, and other product teams to improve the functionality and internationalisation efforts of our address system. Moreover, you will closely work with our user insights and support team to resolve any issues associated with incorrect addresses.

Tasks


 * Developing a deep knowledge of our Places product, including core components like address system integration, geosolutions, normalisation, and geocoding.
 * Collaborating with software and data engineers to enhance existing product functionality, expand into new countries, and drive internationalisation efforts.
 * Perform deep dives and analysis of geocoding data to derive meaningful insights.
 * Actively engaging with other product teams, user insights, and customer support to address issues stemming from inaccurate geocoding.
 * Coordinating with internal stakeholders and adopting an iterative approach to resolve project challenges and troubleshoot ongoing issues.
 * Leading through team rituals, prioritisation, and product conceptualization.
   
   
   

Requirements


 * 2-4 years of experience as a Product Owner, with at least 2 years in a technical capacity.
 * High technical affinity with a basic technical background; proficient in any programming language, able to test APIs, understand concepts like requests/second, throttling, rate limits, and execute simple SQL queries in the production environment.
 * Strong data analytical skills, with a particular interest in GEO data. You enjoy working with data and feel comfortable taking ownership of dashboards alongside data analysts.
 * Skilled in iterative product development and familiar with Agile methodologies.
 * A hands-on mentality and self-driven approach without the need for micromanaging.
 * Excellent English communication and management skills for coordinating with internal and external stakeholders at all levels.
   
   
   

IT IS AWESOME IF YOU ALSO HAVE


 * Familiarity with B2B SaaS products and their dynamics.
 * Interest and experience in working on greenfield topics, as well as improving existing products and concepts.
 * A background in data analysis and geospatial data.
 * Experience using Confluence and Jira
   
   
   

Take your chance and step to the forefront of changing a rapidly growing industry with your contribution. You will take responsibility quickly, however, supported by mentors at all times. We provide an open corporate culture based on sharing and learning, equal footing collaboration, and short decision-making.

At the moment we only proceed with candidates who are authorised to work in Germany OR already have a Job Seekers Visa.

About Us

With Bettermile no more delivery is as usual. We transform last-mile logistics to boost productivity and create an exceptional delivery experience.

This is why we provide a geo-based and AI-powered SaaS product suite for dynamic, multi-constraint, many-stop address processing, routing, and navigation.

We're setting a new standard for the last mile. And raising the bar for the delivery industry. All thanks to our seasoned, international team of tech enthusiasts and logistics experts and a truly dynamic product suite.

Susanne Gruber contacthr@paessler.com

title: Product Manager Director - Fraud
description:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Vestiaire Collective is looking for a Product Manager Director to join the Operation & Customer experience Team in either Singapore or Ho Chi Min City or Berlin
About The Role 🖥️
Reporting directly to the VP of Product Operations & Customer experience, you will work within the Product team, at a Director level.

The role is based in, (depending on the talent) Singapore, Ho Chi Minh or Berlin.

You’ll be responsible for critical parts of the customer experience such as Fraud prevention through sign-up, deposit flow, purchase and post-purchase as well as creating a trusted and safe environment for our customers applying relevant trust markers. The ability to leverage AI to automate and optimize decision-making is core to this role. So we are looking for someone who is working at ease at the intersection of data and customer experience/UX.

What You Will Do 👜


 * Being responsible for the product strategy for Fraud and potentially Trust - depending on the product vision set
 * Working seamlessly along the product development cycle from problem definition to solution design, execution, and ideation/iteration
 * Partner closely with Research, Design, Analytics, Data and of course Engineering - following modern product development methodologies to identify new issues and opportunities and to deliver on improvements to existing products
 * Putting data first, enabling for data driven decision-making, also applying the right data sources to verify and identify relevant issues
 * Leverage AI to automate and optimize processes — also ensuring algorithm fairness and explainability of data models in the daily work
 * Acknowledging Fraud as a constant threat but also opportunity to create a trustworthy environment for the good actors on the platform
 * Cultivate high engagement, performance, and commitment to the product teams to build collectively well-defined and appropriate best-in class solutions
 * Being a front-runner for practicing Product Development in the best possible way, also participating as an interviewer and mentor for future and current employees
   
   
   
   

Who You Are ⭐


 * At least 7 years of product management experience. Not as a Product Owner, but a well-rounded Product Manager
 * At least 3 years relevant experience working with data products and AI. You have delivered on proven products and have a good understanding of the technical basics
 * Strong strategic thinker with an ability to construct and communicate logical arguments using appropriate narratives
 * Applying the best communication method to your respective stakeholders is part of your DNA
 * Being proficient in the right product management tools and techniques
 * Showing you a set of data to enable the right decisions is making you happy. You know the value of data and know how to get it
 * KPIs, OKRs P&L are core concepts you are deeply familiar with and you thrive in working on topics that matter based on measurable evidence
   
   
   
   

What we offer 🎁

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

Significant investment in your learning and growth

Competitive compensation and benefits package (i.e 28 days of paid time off)

As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Surveys show that women and members of underrepresented communities only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the required conditions. Does this sound like you? If so, Vestiaire Collective encourages you to reconsider your application. We look forward to receiving your application!

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer

title: Product Owner Data (m/w/d)

title: Product Owner (m/w/d)
description:
Als Product Owner bist Du der CEO des Produktes und schaffst zusammen mit Deinem internationalen Team einen echten Value für unsere Kunden. Dabei übernimmst Du die zentrale Planung und Steuerung anspruchsvoller e-Commerce Plattform Lösungen auf Basis von Composable Commerce. Dich erwartet eine Arbeitsumgebung die geprägt ist durch Transparenz, Partnerschaft und Vertrauen. Aus diesem Grund sind wir stets bestrebt, dem Unternehmen die beste Qualität und einen sinnvollen Wert zu liefern. Unsere Arbeitsweise ist geprägt durch agile Denkweise und Arbeitsmethoden und einen ausgereiften Technologieansatz der auf die individuellen Anforderungen des Kunden abgestimmt ist.

Aufgaben

DEINE MISSION:


 * Du übernimmst als PO die zentrale Rolle für die Entwicklung und die Optimierung der digitalen Customer Journey
 * Dabei verstehst Du die Business- und Kundenbedürfnisse und konzipierst Produktlösungen, die den Wünschen der verschiedenen Stakeholdern gerecht werden und die Team-/Projektziele erreichen
 * Als Ansprechpartner*in für alle Fachbereiche erfasst du die Anforderungen in einem übergreifenden Backlog und begleitest diese in der Implementierung gemeinsam mit deinem Entwicklungsteam und QA´s
 * Mit unseren UX Designer*innen arbeitest Du eng bei der Umsetzung von neuen innovativen Produkten zusammen
 * Du verzahnst dich intern als auch extern mit den unterschiedlichen Fachbereichen und treibst bereichsübergreifende Themen voran
 * Du bist zentrale(r) Ansprechpartner*in für alle Fragen rund um das Produkt
   
   
   

Qualifikation

DEIN PROFIL:


 * Studium im Bereich Medieninformatik, Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
 * Du hast mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung als IT Product Owner (m/w/d) und bereits mit Scrum Teams digitale Produkte entwickelt
 * Du hast Erfahrung mit unterschiedlichen Projektmanagementmethoden z.B. Kanban, Scrum und Tools (Jira, Confluence)
 * Du bringst ein gutes technisches Verständnis mit und verstehst wie Gesamtsysteme funktionieren
 * Du hast die Fähigkeit und großen Spaß daran, Komplexität zu managen sowie eine Hands-on-Mentalität
 * Du bist souverän im Stakeholder Management und kannst zwischen unterschiedlichen Interessenslagen abwägen, vermitteln und Lösungen finden
 * Du besitzt sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
   
   
   

Benefits

DAS BIETEN WIR DIR:

Attraktives Gehaltspaket mit tollen Extras

Wir sind an einer langfristigen Zusammenarbeit mit Dir interessiert und bieten Dir neben einem unbefristeten Arbeitsverhältnis ein Paket mit bspw. betrieblicher Altersvorsorge, Jobrad, Kindergarten- oder Fahrtkostenzuschuss.

Wavedays, MeetUps, Hackathons und Konferenzen

Für Deine fachliche Weiterentwicklung bieten wir Dir vielfältige Möglichkeiten, um deinen Horizont zu erweitern. Du kannst z. B. als Circle Lead Verantwortung übernehmen, an Hackathons teilnehmen oder uns bei MeetUps und Konferenzen als Besucher oder Speaker vertreten.

Flache Hierarchien und feste Teams

Du arbeitest in einem festen Team mit einem familiären Arbeitsklima und offenem Austausch auf Augenhöhe – gerne auch nach Feierabend (in unserem eigenen Showroom oder am Pool auf dem Firmengelände).

Verantwortung übernehmen

Mit Deiner Erfahrung hast Du die Chance, Circle Lead zu werden und als Fachexperte/in eine interdisziplinäre Gruppe von Kollegen/innen aus unterschiedlichen Bereichen zu organisieren und weiterzuentwickeln.

Freiraum für Deine Ideen und vertrauensvolle Zusammenarbeit auf Augenhöhe

Neue Impulse stoßen bei uns auf offene Ohren und werden aktiv weiterverfolgt. So kannst Du aktiv die Zukunft des Unternehmens und des Digital Commerce mitgestalten.

Persönliche Weiterentwicklung für Deinen Karrierepfad

Wir erkennen Dein individuelles Potential und fördern Dich gezielt durch unser Mentoringprogramm und Leadership-Initiativen.

Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Möglichkeit zum Homeoffice

So sorgen wir für eine ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance.

title: Product Owner (a)
description:
Role Overview

As AMDT, we are at the forefront of transforming and digitizing the automated production landscape with our flagship product octoplant. By providing the largest manufacturers in the world with the leading data management solution for the OT, we help our customers safeguard their production shopfloorl, reduce downtime and achieve production output targets.

We are now looking for a visionary Product Owner and strategic thinker to lead the evolution of our key product. You will further refine and drive the product vision with customers, and our product and development teams and take end-to-end ownership of the productization process. You act as the voice of the customer, discover and analyze current pain points, and develop solutions in collaboration with the technical teams for whom you prioritze and manage the product backlog.

Your strategic acumen, combined with passion for Automated Production, solving the problems on the OT shopfloor, and building best in class software will catalyze our mission to continue delivering excellent solutions to our customers.

Your Tasks


 * Craft and convey the strategic vision for our core OT data management solution, ensuring alignment with our customers' needs
 * Prioritize and manage the product backlog, emphasizing features that bring value to automated production processes
 * Work closely with product management and development teams to translate insights from automated production into compelling product features and enhancements
 * Foster relationships with internal and external stakeholders to validate product strategies and incorporate user feedback
 * Leverage your experience and knowledge in Automated Production and the OT to continuously increase the value our customers receive
 * Stay abreast of trends and technologies in the automated production sector to inform product innovation
   
   

Your Profile


 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Sciences, Economics, Business, or a related field; Master’s or PhD degree is preferable
 * At least 3-5 years of experience as a Product Owner/ Product Manager
 * Interest and ideally experience in Automated Production and OT environment
 * Both technical prowess and business acumen to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders across all levels
 * Proficient in agile methodologies with relevant certification or experience
 * Data driven personality, i.e.: measure and analyze key performance indicators related to the product and progress
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills
   
   

That sounds like you?

Then don't wait any longer and send us your resume. We are looking forward to the exchange with you!

Chiara Germani is your contact person.

Reasons to become part of AMDT


 * Transformative Opportunities: Be part of a transformative company undergoing dynamic changes, offering numerous opportunities for growth and development.
 * Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse and supportive community where your contributions are valued, and collaboration thrives.
 * Flexible Work Options: Work how you work best—remotely, hybrid, or from our state-of-the-art office.
 * Future Security: We invest in your future with a comprehensive pension plan, contributing 20% towards your direct insurance (deferred compensation).
 * Celebrating Milestones: Enjoy special bonuses and gifts for significant life events like marriage, the birth of a child, or your 10-year anniversary with us.
 * Wellness Programs: Prioritize your well-being with monthly relaxation sessions in Landau to help you unwind and recharge.
 * Sustainable Commutes: Promote a healthy lifestyle with JobRad, our bike leasing program, for an eco-friendly commute.
 * Continuous Learning: Access Preply for easy language learning, supporting your personal and professional growth.
   
   

About Us

AMDT is the global market and technology leader for versioning and backup solutions in industrial automation. With its octoplant software platform, the company secures the automation of production processes through strong end-point management, where it consistently records and monitors changes to configurations, programming and project statuses in production. This minimizes downtime, increases efficiency, quality and safety standards, and saves costs as well as resources. As a modular solution, octoplant can be linked to different automation technologies and devices, regardless of the manufacturer.

AMDT was formed in 2022 from the merger of the two established market leaders AUVESY GmbH and MDT Software Inc. The company is headquartered in Landau, Pfalz, Germany, with additional locations in the USA and China. The company works with more than 100 partners on all continents and serves over 3,000 customers worldwide

More information at: amdt.com

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. AMDT maintains a drug-free workplace.
